entry.title: my first blog post
entry.content:
Terri Lee Nielsen, Davinci Coders

Jason Noble, Instructor – Building the Ruby Toolbelt

July 17, 2013

It’s nice to open my first github blog….!

My past professional work, and passions have involved :

  1. Entrepreneurial project management in real estate, and medical device sales – 17 years

  2. K-16 education – I hold a K-12 Principal license, & K-12 Special Ed Director license, specialties in Literacy & STEM for Gifted Learners, English Lang. Acquisition – ELL students, & School Psychology – Gifted, Autism, .. + similar

First Day of Ruby Programming Class – 7 – 15 – 2013 –

I’m spending as many spare minutes as I can carve out, researching my “aggregate reason for wanting to learn to code.”

  1. Though I recently sold my “Co-founding Board Member” financial interest in a Medical Sales company, I hope to continue working in the Medical field as part of a consultative team helping a hospital or physician practice successfully transition to use of EMRs, EHRs – Electronic Medical Records / Electronic Health Records.

  2. The physicians / hospital group that I hope to open a working relationship doing this – feel overwhelmed about all that is involved.

** This link describes some of the staggering costs :

http://www.forbes.com/sites/zinamoukheiber/2012/06/18/the-staggering-cost-of-an-epic-electronic-health-record-might-not-be-worth-it/

** This link talks about a hospital CEO in California, who believed he could implement “Free Source.” So far, 1 + year into the process, he does not regret passing up consultants & sales

http://www.forbes.com/sites/zinamoukheiber/2012/08/24/open-source-electronic-health-records-a-cost-solution-for-hospitals/ Robert Wentz, Oroville Hospital – Northern California Hospital,

With this Building the Ruby Tool-Belt course, I have a burning desire to learn the Ruby Coding Language, within the EHRs medical context.

I’m diving into Chris Pine’s key concepts outlined in Learn to Program, 2nd Ed.

I hope that you will want to check-in with my posts along my way to Building the Ruby Tool-Belt ….!

Terri Lee Nielsen Golden, Colorado

Davinci Coders Davinci Institute Boulder, Colorado
